nodes.bodyText:
I modified the script s.t. it defaults to cdh6.3.0 (since I hate typing too much :) ):
#!/bin/bash

platform=cdh6.3.0

function help() {
  echo "sck.sh [--platform=<platform>] command"
  echo "<platform> The cluster platform, default is cdh6.3.0"
}

if [ $# -eq 0 ]
then
  help
else
  if [ $1 = "platform" ]
  then
     platform=$2
     shift 2
  fi
  mvn -q -Pcore,${platform} -f ./splice_ck/pom.xml exec:java -Dexec.args="$*"
fi

If a table exists in multiple schemas, this will always select the latest one. It'd be nice to be able to specify the schema. We'd need to find a way to distinguish between the schema in which the table resides and the schema you already use here (boolean, int, etc.)
Also, table names and schema names should be normalised (EngineUtils.validateTable, EngineUtils.validateSchema) so that the end user can write t2 instead of T2 for example.
Good point(s) :)
